metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2816 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 46.0 allows remote attackers to bypass the Content Security Policy (CSP) protection mechanism via the multipart/x-mixed-replace content type.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
